post.description: Creates a notification and places it on the message bus

parameters.description: The amount of time (seconds) to wait for a sync response. After the timeout has elapsed, the response will be available asynchronously through webhooks.
parameters.name: x-timeout

x-rate-limit.description: Total number of available requests before being throttled

x-request-duration.description: Time in seconds it took to receive the response

parameters.description: An idempotency key is a unique value generated by the client which the server uses to recognize subsequent retries of the same request. How you create unique keys is up to you, but we suggest using V4 UUIDs, or another random string with enough entropy to avoid collisions. Idempotency keys can be up to 255 characters long
parameters.name: idempotency-key
